name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Pennsylvania research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Pennsylvania ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Pennsylvania ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Pennsylvania research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Pennsylvania research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Pennsylvania Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ FS—Pennsylvania Research: Overview—18:11

  2. Learn more about Pennsylvania research.

    ☆ AR—Researching Your Pennsylvania Ancestors
    ☆ AAC—Genealogical Research in the Keystone State—Video series (account required)

  3. Here's a guide to tracing your Pennsylvania ancestors.

    ☆ AF—Tracing Your Pennsylvania Ancestors

  4. Follow this research study for Pennsylvania ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Pennsylvania Research, 1880-Present

  5. Read the Pennsylvania German Guide for tips on researching ancestors of German descent.

    ☆ AA—Pennsylvania German Guide

  6. Learn about research in colonial Pennsylvania.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Pennsylvania
Records and Resources

1. Record Finder: Use the Pennsylvania Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Pennsylvania Record Finder

  2. Ancestry: Explore resources for Pennsylvania research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Pennsylvania Resources
    ☆ AC—Pennsylvania State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  3. Databases and Resources: Explore online databases and sites for Pennsylvania research.

    ☆ TH—Pennsylvania Genealogy Online

  4. Find additional Pennsylvania resources in these articles.

    ☆ Resources for Pennsylvania Research
    ☆ AA—Pennsylvania Genealogy

  5. Watch this video for finding Pennsylvania research resources.

    ☆ AA—Resources for Pennsylvania Genealogy—61:33

  6. Learn about county records available in Pennsylvania.

    ☆ AAC—County Records: Introduction and Overview—5:58
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Follow these case studies for Pennsylvania research.

    ☆ LDS—Verifying the family of a Pennsylvania man with a common name
    ☆ LDS—Finding the family of a Pennsylvania woman with no birth record
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Pennsylvania in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Pennsylvania
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Pennsylvania Minorities

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—Pennsylvania African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Pennsylvania.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Pennsylvania in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Pennsylvania

1. Explore Pennsylvania historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Pennsylvania History

  2. Explore Pennsylvania history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Pennsylvania

  3. Learn about Pennsylvania history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Pennsylvania History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Pennsylvania archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Pennsylvania archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Pennsylvania archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Pennsylvania Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Pennsylvania State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about the online Pennsylvania state archives.

    ☆ FS—Online Pennsylvania State Archives

  3. Learn about finding archive records in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Pennsylvania Repositories—6:08

  4. Take advantage of resources in the Published Pennsylvania Archives.

    ☆ RT—Finding Buried Treasure in the Published Pennsylvania Archives—25:12


  5. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Pennsylvania.
  6. Explore the Pennsylvania Dept of Archives site.
  7. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Pennsylvania genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  8. Search for ☆free online books on Pennsylvania research on the FamilySearch site.
  9. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Pennsylvania ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Pennsylvania city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Pennsylvania Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Pennsylvania city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Pennsylvania city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Pennsylvania ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Pennsylvania city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Pennsylvania research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Pennsylvania County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Pennsylvania.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Pennsylvania Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Pennsylvania research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Pennsylvania Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Pennsylvania Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Pennsylvania Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Pennsylvania.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Pennsylvania research.
  2. Explore the Pennsylvania research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Pennsylvania research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Pennsylvania research.
  5. Explore Pennsylvania research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Explore the Genealogy Society of Pennsylvania site.
  2. Learn about genealogy societies in Pennsylvania in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Pennsylvania Societies

  3. Visit the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania page on Facebook.
  4. Explore Pennsylvania genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Pennsylvania.
